The claim was made by the Kenya Auto Baz: 2. The claim was challenged by a lobby group, stating that the total import tax on both used and new cars averaged KSh47.3 billion in the last two financial years.
The claim was based on an estimate made: using figures such as the number of imports and the average duty paid to import a typical saloon car.
The claim was compared to the total tax: 17 and 2017/18 financial years, indicating that the claimed amount of KSh49 billion would constitute approximately 3% of the taxman's total annual collection.
